etymology.description: semantic: 攵(攴) (pū, 'tap') + phonetic: 每(每) (měi, 'each') = quick movements -> sensitive; quick
etymology.interpretation: The character 敏(mǐn) suggests quick or sensitive actions, combining 攴(攴) (pū, 'tap'), symbolizing action, with 每(每) (měi, 'each'), which hints at repetitive or efficient action.

examples.chinese: 他做事十分敏捷(他做事十分敏捷)，总能迅速反应(總能迅速反應)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuò shì shífēn mǐnjié, zǒng néng xùnsù fǎnyìng.
examples.english: He is very quick in his actions, always responding swiftly.

examples.chinese: 她天生很敏感(她天生很敏感)，容易察觉情绪变化(容易察覺情緒變化)。
examples.pinyin: Tā tiānshēng hěn mǐngǎn, róngyì chájué qíngxù biànhuà.
examples.english: She is naturally sensitive and easily perceives mood changes.
